title: How to Make Eggplant Dip

steps.headline: Bake the eggplant for 30 minutes, until the outside is crisp and the inside is soft.
Cool on the side for about 20 minutes.
Cut the eggplant open.
steps.description: Scoop the flesh out into a colander and allow the juices to drain for at least 10 minutes. With this process, you'll eliminate the bitter flavor that it gives.

steps.headline: Place the drained eggplant flesh in a medium bowl.
Add the garlic clove, lemon juice, tahini, salt, and 3 teaspoons olive oil into the bowl.
Mash everything together.
steps.description: You can use the bottom of the fork prongs or pulsing with a food processor for 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Serve the dip.
steps.description: Add the mixture in a serving bowl and garnish it with extra olive oil and lemon juice.

text: Preheat the oven to 375ºF or 190ºC.  Bake the eggplant for 30 minutes, until the outside is crisp and the inside is soft.  Cool on the side for about 20 minutes.  Cut the eggplant open. Scoop the flesh out into a colander and allow the juices to drain for at least 10 minutes. With this process, you'll eliminate the bitter flavor that it gives. Place the drained eggplant flesh in a medium bowl.  Add the garlic clove, lemon juice, tahini, salt, and 3 teaspoons olive oil into the bowl.  Mash everything together. You can use the bottom of the fork prongs or pulsing with a food processor for 2 minutes. Serve the dip. Add the mixture in a serving bowl and garnish it with extra olive oil and lemon juice. Finished.
